data.description:
Whoosh! Bam! Pow! Remember playing with action figures? Unwrap your Crumbling from its blister package and take its fate into your hand - literally. 

Crumbling is a VR rogue-like action adventure where you control your character as if it was an action figure in your hand. Move it around meticulously hand-crafted dioramas using your touch controller. Or use the native hand-tracking of the Oculus Quest. Fight against an onslaught of plastic monsters in hack'n'slash combat that is all about timing. 

Discover the story of the endearing Mr. and Mrs. Crumble through animated and narrated comic books. Learn how the evil Böse Corp. stole all their magic in order to make their horrible monster toys come alive. 

Are you ready to wield your Crumbling against the evil minions of Böse Corp. and reclaim the magic?

changelog.change_log:
- App security improvement
- Fixed instruction UI when using hand-tracking
- Close results comic using pinch gesture

### Added
- Evade, you sleek chum! Press B to spin and become intangible for a moment.
- A new monster that looks like a concierge made of jelly, because why not?
- Pause the game by opening the in-game menu. Gives the extra matrix slowmo feel, too!
- Pick up and repair worms that were smashed by Böse Corp. - those derpy fellas
- Take a drink from the fountain to heal along the way!
- A comic page will summarize your run when returning to the hub scene.

### Changed
- Monster won't be interrupted quite as easily now. Oh, boy! Good thing you can do that evade thing now.
- Randomized encounters that get harder from room to room.
- Much more fancy dioramas to fight in.
- Speech bubbles much more bubbly. Blub.
- Improved in-game menu and control instructions.
- New, fancy title image as splash screen. Much wow!
- Visualize possible interaction with exclamation mark!!!11one
- Targeted monster has a white outline now

### Fixed
- Crumbling will not target enemies anymore immediately after they die
- Lots of minor things

First App Lab Release.

Feature set:
- Unwrap your Crumbling player character from its blister package.
- Control your Crumbling by moving your motion controller through the scene as if it was an action figure in your hand.
- Put away your controllers and use hand-tracking and gestures instead.
- Meet an onslaught of plastic monsters with unique attack patterns in hack'n'slash combat.
- Enjoy the meticulously hand-crafted dioramas that the world of Crumb is made of.
- Grow stronger and meet the end boss in a rogue-like game loop
- Collect crystals to unlock a new Crumbling player character with a unique action set
